column4: can someone please paste me their GRUB menu.list file please???  I did not install the bootloader and i get some strange error when Ubuntu boots.
the odds of theirs working for you is not good
yes i'm aware of hte partition numbers
i just want to see if it matches my old Debian /initrd etc
because i had debian in that partition and installed ubuntu and booted ubuntu without changing menu.lst
I have feisty on this box so that probably wont help you
oh here is how the existing menu.lst for Ubuntu looks like, it says Debian but its ubuntu. (pasting only the entry) http://phpfi.com/277520
can you just check whether there is a link called "vmlinuz" in /boot of your existing install?
and whethere there is a link named "initrd.img"  in /boot
It looks like I have, but my kernel revisin number is added to it
but there has got to be a link named just "initrd" and "vmlinuz" without the version numbers.. or is that in "/" could u check? because the idea is it links to your specific kernel version
ah so you have links named "initrd" and "vmlinuz" (WITHOUT the version numbers in /boot) ? right ?
thx a lot , i'll change my grub entry and try :)
fixed it .. it was not /boot or /root
